1.title: Make a Bird Feeder
1.description: Create a simple bird feeder using recycled materials and observe local wildlife
instructions: Clean an empty plastic bottle thoroughly
Cut small holes around the bottle for birds to access seeds
Fill the bottle with bird seeds
Make holes at the top and thread string for hanging
Hang outside and observe which birds visit!

2.title: Start a Herb Garden
2.description: Grow your own herbs on a windowsill and learn about sustainable food
instructions: Choose easy herbs like basil, mint, or parsley
Fill small pots with soil
Plant seeds according to packet instructions
Place in a sunny window
Water regularly and watch them grow!

3.title: Nature Scavenger Hunt
3.description: Explore your local area and discover different plants, animals, and natural objects
instructions: Create a list of items to find (leaves, rocks, flowers)
Go to a local park or nature area
Search for items on your list
Take photos instead of picking flowers
Discuss what you found with family

4.title: Water Filter Experiment
4.description: Build a simple water filter and learn how water purification works
instructions: Cut a plastic bottle in half
Layer cotton, sand, and gravel in the top half
Place the top half upside down in the bottom half
Pour dirty water through the filter
Observe how the water becomes cleaner!

5.title: Eco-Friendly Cleaning
5.description: Make natural cleaning products with your family using safe ingredients
instructions: Mix baking soda and water for scrubbing paste
Combine vinegar and water in spray bottle
Add lemon juice for fresh scent
Test on small areas first
Use to clean surfaces together as a family

6.title: Recycled Art Project
6.description: Create beautiful art pieces using materials that would otherwise be thrown away
instructions: Collect clean recyclable materials
Plan your art project design
Cut and shape materials as needed
Paint and decorate your creation
Display your eco-friendly artwork!

7.title: Energy Audit Challenge
7.description: Work with family to identify ways to save energy around your home
instructions: Walk through your home room by room
Check for lights left on unnecessarily
Look for leaky windows or doors
Test water temperature settings
Make a plan to improve energy efficiency

8.title: Pollinator Garden
8.description: Plant flowers that attract bees and butterflies to support local ecosystems
instructions: Research native flowers in your area
Choose a sunny spot in your yard
Prepare the soil by removing weeds
Plant seeds according to instructions
Water and maintain your pollinator garden

9.title: Weather Station
9.description: Build instruments to measure and track weather patterns
instructions: Create a rain gauge using a clear container
Build a wind vane with cardboard and a straw
Set up a thermometer in the shade
Record daily weather measurements
Track patterns over several weeks

10.title: Composting Bin
10.description: Start composting food scraps to reduce waste and create rich soil
instructions: Choose a container or designated area
Layer brown materials (leaves, paper)
Add green materials (food scraps, grass)
Turn the compost regularly
Use finished compost in your garden

11.title: Solar Oven
11.description: Build a solar oven and cook food using only the power of the sun
instructions: Line a cardboard box with aluminum foil
Place black paper on the bottom
Cover with plastic wrap to create greenhouse effect
Angle toward the sun
Try cooking simple foods like s'mores!

12.title: Wildlife Photography
12.description: Document local wildlife and create a nature photography journal
instructions: Research local wildlife in your area
Visit parks or nature areas early morning
Be patient and quiet to observe animals
Take photos from a respectful distance
Create a nature journal with your photos
